required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Odevixibat in Patients With Alagille Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Odevixibat (A4250) in Patients With Alagille Syndrome (ASSERT-EXT)

brief_summary.textblock: An Open Label Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Odevixibat (A4250) in Patients with Alagille Syndrome (ASSERT-EXT)

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 35 sites will be initiated for this study in North America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia Pacific.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in scratching score as measured by the Albireo Observer-Reported Outcome Caregiver Instrument

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in serum bile acids
Change from baseline in quality-of-life assessment as measured by the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Questionnaire
Change from baseline in sleep parameters as measured by the Albireo Patient and Observer-Reported Outcome instruments
Change from baseline in global symptom relief as measured by both the Global Impression of Symptoms and Global Impression of Change questionnaires
Safety and Tolerability as assessed by the Number of Participants with Treatment-emergent Adverse Events as Assessed by CTCAE v5.0

arm_group.description: Capsules for oral administration once daily for 72 weeks.

intervention.description: Odevixibat is a small molecule and selective inhibitor of IBAT.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Completion of the 24-week Treatment Period of Study A4250-012
2. Signed informed consent and assent as appropriate. Patients who turn 18 years of age (or legal age per country) during the study will be required to re-consent to remain on the study
3. Caregivers (and age-appropriate patients) must be willing and able to use an electronic diary (eDiary) device as required by the study
4. Sexually active males and females must agree to use a reliable contraceptive method with â‰¤1% failure rate (such as hormonal contraception, intra-uterine device, or complete abstinence) from signed informed consent through 90 days after last dose of study drug.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Decompensated liver disease, history or presence of clinically significant ascites, variceal hemorrhage, and/or encephalopathy
2. Patients who were not compliant with study drug treatment or procedures in Study A4250-012
3. Any other conditions or abnormalities which, in the opinion of the investigator, may compromise the safety of the patient, or interfere with the patient participating in or completing the study
4. Known hypersensitivity to any components of odevixibat

facility.name: The Childrens Hospital at Montefiore Albert Einstein School of Medicine
